column1: Since the outbreak of COVID-19 violence against women particularly domestic violence has intensified.  On the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women we must shine a light on this epidemic & recommit ourselves to eliminating it. https://t.co/21JmMsyeTn

Traveling for the holidays?   ✅ Wear a mask ✅ Wash your hands ✅ Stay at least 6 ft apart from others   Remember the best way to avoid getting or spreading COVID-19 is by staying home. However if you do travel do so safely. https://t.co/LXenWMuc67

As COVID-19 cases increase across the country it’s important to make sure you have access to affordable health care coverage for the new year.  The Affordable Care Act’s Open Enrollment is going on right now! #GetCovered before Dec. 15 at https://t.co/CyeYQNOdGu. https://t.co/c1iHVqkSk3

@TexasDSHS is preparing to distribute potential FDA-approved COVID-19 vaccines. Texas will allocate COVID-19 vaccines to health care and frontline workers as well as vulnerable communities first in order to provide the most protection. Learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/Z68FRZxEWk

Open enrollment for health insurance under the Affordable Care Act is available until Dec. 15. During this #COVID19 crisis get covered today.  Check out https://t.co/aGNO4GfTi1 for more information. https://t.co/dxa2Vkadkv

Our nation’s farmers & ranchers are resilient. However they are still facing many challenges due to the pandemic.   The @usdafsa has implemented an additional Coronavirus Food Assistance Program for agricultural producers who face market disruptions because of COVID-19. https://t.co/4w55jxC72X
Voting like everything else this year looks different thanks to the coronavirus pandemic. Learn how to protect yourself while early voting or on November 3rd.  https://t.co/I80Wu76wDw

As our nations grapples with the pandemic Head Start programs throughout the country continue to support and teach our children.   The future success of the United States is at risk if we fail to support Head Start in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/QiNIIme55a

The CARES Act—which included one-time cash payments of $1200—bolstered incomes & spurred spending. W/ the updated #HeroesAct @HouseDemocrats are continuing to put money directly into families’ pockets through additional direct payments to cushion the economic blow of COVID-19. https://t.co/wmIrvhJQT9

The effects of coronavirus on children and their education is deeply concerning.   That’s why I voted for the updated #HeroesAct to provide $225 billion for education nationwide including $182 billion for K12 schools & nearly $39 billion for postsecondary education. https://t.co/Xxq4UDa25I

Coronavirus has exacerbated food insecurity a challenge many faced even before the pandemic.   @HouseDemocrats’ updated #HeroesAct provides a critical 15% increase to the maximum SNAP benefit & additional funding for nutrition programs that help families put food on the table. https://t.co/FCz6xEFFtN

Farmworkers feed America. Amidst COVID-19 they have been the backbone of America.   There could be no one worth honoring more this Hispanic Heritage Month than farmworkers. #HHM  https://t.co/qShU4cwLW8

“My biggest concern is that we’re going to lose these kids” one teacher said. “They might never come back.”   We must pass a new COVID-19 relief package to ensure our children have access to equitable education. https://t.co/Uyd13gP6ga

Latino communities have been disproportionately harmed by the COVID-19 pandemic. That’s why it’s crucial to ensure that clinical trials for a COVID-19 vaccine fully reflect America’s diversity and include the hardest-hit populations. #HHM  https://t.co/hR6zvFdZ2f

A devastating milestone: More than 200000 Americans have died.    Behind every COVID-19 death is the loss of a family member friend neighbor classmate or coworker.    We will continue to pray for those currently combating this virus and remember the loved ones we have lost.

The #HeroesAct includes the necessary funding for aggressive testing tracing and treatment which scientists say is required to defeat the virus and grow our economy.   It’s time to go on offense against COVID to get people safely back to work and back to school. https://t.co/vMHJQrsEy0

Today marks the beginning of Hispanic Heritage Month.   This month we honor Hispanic Americans’ countless contributions to our nation. Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic Hispanics are proving themselves more essential than ever and resilient in the face of adversity. #HHM https://t.co/mGmr1ImVVe

It’s been 117 days since Democrats passed the #HeroesAct legislation that responds to #COVID19 by supporting states & localities. We cannot turn our backs when it comes to providing residents with: 🏠 Rental assistance 📚 Safe reopening of schools 🏬 Small biz aid #SaveOurStates
Firefighters Nurses Paramedics Teachers Sanitation workers They are all critical to the fight against COVID-19.  The #HeroesAct delivers the urgent resources frontline workers need to save lives.

The coronavirus crisis is hitting state & local government hard – forcing many to make devastating cuts to public education. The #HeroesAct provides nearly $1 trillion in state & local relief to preserve funding for students and schools. #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/bpYLR5We6x

While we continue to address COVID-19 we have seen reports about increases in opioid-related mortality.   On #InternationalOverdoseAwarenessDay we remember those we have to lost to addiction & recommit our fight for those still combating this disease. https://t.co/ROEXaD7MjU

To protect our democracy from the #coronavirus @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct in May to ensure that states can safely conduct elections.   No one should have to choose between their health and their vote. https://t.co/CHTra7gi1s

Local governments are providing massive resources to combat the coronavirus crisis. But they can’t do it alone.     The Senate must pass the #HeroesAct to provide direct flexible funding to counter the budgetary effects of this pandemic.  https://t.co/REC7UvxWS3
Our health care system in Starr County was already strained and under-resourced before the COVID-19 outbreak. Now it is beyond overwhelmed on the brink of collapse.  https://t.co/FqBvTYpcv7

In light of COVID-19 related school closures about 1.2 million children in military families will require childcare.   I joined a bipartisan letter to Secretary @EsperDoD urging the @DeptofDefense to develop plans that ensure all military families have access to childcare. https://t.co/97Gjp4zgXl

As we celebrate 55 years of the Voting Rights Act our work to ensure access to the ballot isn’t over. Congress must pass the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Act and we must give states the resources they need to #ProtectOurVote amid the COVID-19 crisis. #VRA55 https://t.co/lFmb68gsgz

As we continue to fight COVID-19 don't miss important updates from my office on federal resources events legislation and constituent services.  Sign up for my weekly newsletter to keep up with my work in Washington D.C. and South Texas: https://t.co/UzjyvxTXEz https://t.co/yapSuts5fm

Millions of parents were struggling to find quality affordable child care even before the coronavirus pandemic. That’s why I am co-sponsoring the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act to allocate federal funds into better child care options for working families. #SaveChildCare https://t.co/HFAwjVRbnc

This morning on the @HouseDemocrats I gave an update on the COVID-19 outbreak in South Texas & the need to provide direct aid to local governments & schools. We need to act now & address the skyrocketing costs local governments face as they continue to battle this pandemic. https://t.co/7BfXiwiM3u

The COVID-19 pandemic has overwhelmed South Texas communities and local governments. First responders and health care professionals are working to provide resources and services to help combat this virus. Now South Texans must also face destruction caused by Hurricane Hanna.

Coronavirus has worsened America’s food security crisis. That’s why @AppropsDems and I worked to create the FY21 Agriculture-Rural Development-FDA bill which puts safe healthy food on American tables by including strong funding for food and nutrition programs. https://t.co/dnnQhsdPv2

With millions of cases nationwide we have ALL been personally victimized by #COVID19. Mask up & stop the spread of this pandemic. #OnWednesdaysWeWearPink https://t.co/D57vdnjLNL

It is critical that we continue to work together to control the spread of #COVID19 in our communities. We must take this seriously to protect our friends and family.   🏠 Stay home as much as possible      😷Wear a mask 🧼 Wash your hands often    🧍‍♀️ Practice social distancing🧍

COVID-19 data collection & reporting needs to be done in a transparent & trustworthy manner & cannot be partisan. https://t.co/Jgh6MG6rec

My condolences go out to @JoaquinCastrotx & @JulianCastro on the loss of their stepmother to COVID-19 as well as anyone else who has lost a loved one to this virus.  Please continue to wear a mask & social distance to protect yourself and others. Together we will overcome this.
